long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension lets you quickly search highlighted text in a new tab by holding Ctrl and clicking on your selection. Compatible with Windows, Mac (use Command), Chromebook 

**Additional Settings:**

Hold Mouse + Press Ctrl Mode (Default Off):
Enabling this mode allows you to search by highlighting text and pressing Ctrlâ€”without releasing the mouse button. Note that this may interfere with keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl+C or Ctrl+V.

Always Use Google (Default On):
When turned on, all searches are done using Google, and the resulting tab is opened immediately to the right of the current one. If you turn this setting off, the extension will use your default search engine instead. In that case, the new tab might appear at the end of your tab strip, but the extension will then move it next to your current tab.

Additional Keyboard Shortcut:
Want to trigger a search with a keyboard shortcut instead? Go to
chrome://extensions/shortcuts
to configure your own shortcut keys (Default: Alt+S).

**Restrictions:**
1. This extension will NOT work on restricted Chrome-managed pages like the Chrome web store or Chrome pdf reader
2. If you reload the extension, make sure to reload any opened tabs to reset the extension
